content.description: An obvious steep arete.  First climbed ground up on trad gear.  Kind of reachy.
content.location: Locate the obvious arete and face to the left of Blue Sky, Green Water.

content.description: Climb the bolts that follow the arete until they run out. A move or three gets you to a nice horizontal for gear. One more bolt up and right leads to the anchor.
content.protection: The horizontal crack above the second to last bolt will take a .75 camalot.
content.location: This route is on the southeast arete of Blue Sky Buttress. It starts left of Dyslexia or you can start on the ground.

content.description: Fun climbing with a slab/technical crux in the middle.  Guidebook gives a 11b but some might find it a bit harder!
content.location: Shares anchors with deliverance (left of deliverance)

content.description: Obed's only real wide crack.  Only 5.9 (yosemite wide crack rating) but you might get humbled pretty quick if you're not ready.
content.protection: A few big pieces.  A bit runout in the chimney.
content.location: The obvious wide crack to the left of Blue Sky, Green Water.

content.description: This route is a fun series of slightly overhanging jugs with a few crimps to make it pumpy. Follow the line of bolts up to the anchor.
content.protection: New bolts as of 2018, thank you ETCC!
content.location: Start on the ground or the ledge. This route is in the middle of the east-facing wall climber’s left of Deliverance. It is right of Sense of Accomplishment.

content.description: Climbs the face right of the Blue Sky Buttress. A few long reaches are needed. Pull around the mini roof to start, climb up through a few sharp edges. A few long reaches get you to the ledge and there are a few more moves before the anchor on lighter orange rock.
content.protection: 10 bolts and anchors. The bolts don't look awesome.
content.location: Upstream from Bare Knuckle Ninja, the right line of two that share an anchor. The left line is Scary Fingers, .11b. Starts in a kind of broken roof.

content.description: This is a great rock climb.  Most routes at Obed have great position but this one may have the best.  Perched above the confluence of the Obed and Clear the view is incredible, the stone is perfect, and the climb is as good as it gets.
content.protection:
2 bolts protect moves down low and one at the crux otherwise the route takes good trad gear. All you need are three/four cams to safely climb this route. Needs a bolted anchor. 

  Cams in order:   1 .5 camalot   1 3 camalot   1 yellow metolius (finger size)   1 purple metolious (tiny)
content.location: Locate the obvious arete upstream of the walk down.

content.description: Climb the big fat crack in the corner, dont worry it climbs much better than it looks
content.location: just to the right of Dyslexia

content.description: A short and powerful bit of climbing with great moves on solid stone.  If this is still a trad climb it's probably not been repeated in a long time.  Go climb it somebody.
content.location: This is the overhanging crack located just down and right (upstream) from the walk down to South Clear Creek.  The business is maybe 35-40 feet but really steep and powerful especially when placing gear.

content.description: This is the area of walls that are climbers left (upstream) of the walk down to South Clear Creek.  The most obvious route in this area is the awesome arete of Blue Sky, Green Water.
